data.convo:
Monte Cello's Downtown does not look like much from the outside. It is wedged into a small triangular shaped building. They are open for lunch and dinner. Their pizza has been a staple of Downtown since 1980.

Their specialty pizzas include spinach and feta cheese pizza, a little too oily for my tastes (it's made with an oil and garlic sauce). A much better choice is Buffalo Chicken Pizza, which is Buffalo sauce topped with cheese and spicy chicken. The chicken has a nice fresh taste to it and while spicy, is never overdone.

But I love the hoagies the best here. My favorite is the tuna hoagie, which is served with cheese, lettuce, tomato, & grilled onions. I know, break out the Listerine strips after eating one of those. If I like something a little zestier, I'll get the Capicola or the Genoa Salami hoagie.

They have a lunch buffet here too. I've never tried it because I prefer my food made-to-order.
